page.title: 14CAREW CASTLE,CRW.AREA,TENBY.
page.content: { Carew Castle was built about 1270. } It stands above the shore on a low limestone outcrop. { It repaced an earlier Norman Motte {and Bailey Castle.}The West Front has {2 great round towers with massive spur {buttresses}to first floor level. { Rhys ap Thomas}had charge of Carew in the 1480's and staged a Grand Tourney to celebrate the victory of{Henry {Tudor. { In the 15th century Sir John Perrot {enlarged the castle.}The{large mull_ {ion windows}date from this time. The changes made Carew Castle a more comfortable home,there are more {cellars}and more{garderobes}than you might expect. { Carew Castle bridges the gap between {the military castles and the fortified {Manor Houses.}At present it is looked after by the{National Parks.
